BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger in the Bavarian Alps is considerable above the treeline. Main problem:fresh snowdrift accumulations. Danger zones occur on steep ridgeline N/E/SW facing slopes, behind discontinuities and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls. Snowdrift accumulations can be triggered as slab avalanches by one sole person and reach medium size. In addition, glide-snow activity on smooth grass-covered slopes in in forest clearances has increased at intermediate altitudes. Avoid zones below glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow is being transported by brisk NW winds, snowdrift accumulations are being deposited atop a melt-freeze crust at intermediate altitudes, atop variable wind crusts higher up. Bonding is often poor. In addition, beneath the thin melt-freeze crust are trigger-prone weak layers of faceted crystals. At lower altitudes the snow base is moist, sometimes wet down to the ground, resulting in reinforced gliding movements of the entire snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Stable high-pressure weather will make avalanche danger levels decrease on the weekend.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Snowdrift accumulations prone to triggering at high altitudes
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger in the Bavarian Alps is considerable above 1500 m. Main problem:fresh snowdrift accumulations. Danger zones occur on steep ridgeline N/E/SW facing slopes, behind discontinuities and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls. Snowdrift accumulations can be triggered as slab avalanches by one sole person and reach medium size. In addition, glide-snow activity on smooth grass-covered slopes in in forest clearances has increased at intermediate altitudes. Avoid zones below glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow is being transported by brisk NW winds, snowdrift accumulations are being deposited atop a melt-freeze crust at intermediate altitudes, atop variable wind crusts higher up. Bonding is often poor. In addition, beneath the thin melt-freeze crust are trigger-prone weak layers of faceted crystals. At lower altitudes the snow base is moist, sometimes wet down to the ground, resulting in reinforced gliding movements of the entire snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Stable high-pressure weather will make avalanche danger levels decrease on the weekend.
